Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Bacteriocin 43 (Bac43; Bacteriocin T8, Bac T8; natural AMPs; Hiracin JM79, HirJM79; bacteriocins; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes)
Sequence Information.Source: Enterococcus faecium; human microbiota:gut, symbiont bacteria

Literature Information.Literature: Of those 21 strains, a representative bacteriocin of strain VRE82, designated bacteriocin 43, was found to be encoded on mobilizable plasmid pDT1 (6.2 kbp) (plasmid-encoded). The predicted mature BacA protein (44 amino acids) showed sequence homology with the membrane-active class IIa bacteriocins of lactic acid bacteria and showed 86% homology with bacteriocin 31 from E. faecalis YI717 and 98% homology with bacteriocin RC714.
Literature Information.Author: Todokoro D, Tomita H, Inoue T, Ike Y.2006
Literature Information.Title: Genetic analysis of bacteriocin 43 of vancomycin-resistant Enterococcus faecium
